claim: A 70-year-old man was first evaluated for an enlarging neck mass with complaints of night sweats, fever, and weight loss. Excisional biopsy confirms the diagnosis of Burkitt lymphoma. The patient is started on a CODOX-M/IVAC chemotherapy regime. The physician notes a marked improvement, but is concerned about a common complication of chemotherapy. The patient is prescribed rasburicase in response to this complication. Which of the following statements describing the patient’s current state is most accurate? : Rasburicase converts uric acid to allantoin, increasing its secretion

supporting.text: Rasburicase is specifically used to prevent tumor lysis syndrome (TLS) by converting uric acid to allantoin, which is more soluble and easily excreted, reducing the risk of renal failure.

attacks.text: Rasburicase is specifically used to prevent tumor lysis syndrome (TLS) by converting uric acid to allantoin, which is more soluble and easily excreted, reducing the risk of renal failure.
Rasburicase may not be effective in all patients, as some may have pre-existing renal impairment that limits the excretion of allantoin.
The use of rasburicase can lead to hypersensitivity reactions, which may complicate the patient's treatment further.
Pre-existing renal impairment can be managed with additional treatments like hydration and diuretics, ensuring rasburicase remains effective.
Hypersensitivity reactions to rasburicase are rare and can be mitigated with pre-medication and monitoring.
Even with hydration and diuretics, severe renal impairment may still limit the effectiveness of rasburicase.
In cases where hypersensitivity occurs, alternative treatments like allopurinol may be less effective at preventing TLS.
